Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to Rush”
Reviews.Author: travelingeast_8
Reviews.Content: Had to bring my mother to Chicago for a specialist at Rush and Marriott was recommended by them. The front desk were very friendly and helpful and the whole place is very clean. The bed's were too firm for me and I woke up many times because of it. I'm sure if I had checked they would have fixed it somehow but my mom needed good rest and I didn't want to wake her. They gave us a special rate since we were there for Rush. The valet service is top notch! The driver's were very polite in helping mom get in and out of the van. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, Good Time.”
Reviews.Author: WiAng
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location, we were attending a concert at the United Center. A bonus is the complimentary shuttle, that took us to our venue and picked us up after. It is pricey with the valet parking and the fee for wi-fi but it was just worth it for us to get the ride to the concert, we could have drinks and not have to worry about it. The hotel was classy, the rooms were comfortable, nice linens, coffee, refrigerator, nice size bathroom. I was not impressed with the way the shower worked, but everything otherwise was good, we had no issues with noise from the streets. If I could improve anything it would be the option for queen size beds, we had 3 in the room so had to take doubles, that just made me cringe, I'm used to a King, and the wi-fi for the price should of worked better. We spent a lot of time (and money) at the bar, Jim was a fun bartender and lots of other concert goers made it a good hang out after the show. We had an appetizer there before the show, the food was good. There wasnt much for food/restaurants in the immediate area that we could tell. Front desk, vallet, shuttle driver, everybody was friendly, highly recommend if your attending a show at the United Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospital location”
Reviews.Author: kerrie_leigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I attended a conference on the premises. The staff were friendly and the bed comfortable. The restaurant is decent and the bartender was very helpful for ideas of places to go. Using a room key to start an elevator was a new one for me. The location is good if you are visiting Rush, but little else. If you are planning on seeing what Chicago has to offer, stay in the city, not here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. We chose it mainly for its location. The front desk staff were helpful and courteous. The room was comfortable and your typical hotel room. The absolute best thing about the hotel is the free shuttle. It will take you anywhere within a mile, and considering the cold, rainy weather we had while in town, it was much appreciated. He took us to dinner and to our meeting. The valet staff was also helpful and happy to call us a cab or point us in the right direction. The biggest downside to this hotel was the noise factor. It is across the street from Rush University Medical Center. During my 2nd night, I was awakened at 4:44am by a loud ambulance siren. The night before, there were almost constant sirens. In addition, the housekeeping staff gets started unusually early. My first morning, they started cleaning before 8am, slamming doors up and down the hallway. I heard every one of them; it was ridiculous. At 8:30am, I had to put out my "do not disturb" sign, because I wasn't ready to leave, yet. I can't figure out why they started so early. I had breakfast one morning in the hotel's restaurant. The food was decent; the service was average and a little slow. It wasn't really worth it. Go out for breakfast if you have the time. Overall, the stay was very good (above average, not excellent), and I'd probably stay here again if I had a another meeting in the area, but the noise really bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nancecar
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a short meeting and the hotel was very close to that, but a little far from all the downtown action. We arrived very late at night after a long and the night staff was wonderful. I wish I would have gotten the woman at the front desk's name -- she checked us in quickly and with a smile. Our room was clean and had everything we needed. The shower was awesome with fantastic water pressure. Nice workout room. The cost to park seemed a bit high but it is Chicago! Had a fantastic salad in the restaurant and the bartender was very accommodating--even making us his very own "Chicago Snow" drink!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for my purpose”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a short time and my friend used her points to get us a room. Staff at the front desk were super nice during check-in. The valet attendants were all the best. Kudos to the staff at this hotel. The hotel sits across from the hospital and is easy to get to (our directions took us straight there). The rooms were nice. The bed was a little soft, but it was bearable. A little cramped from what I've experienced at other Marriott's but it was nice and clean. The bathroom was the typical hotel size and it was clean. The only problem I had was the water took a long time to get hot and there was not hot/cold reference in the shower. You had to turn it this way and that way until you got it to the correct temp. But overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: jwichelt
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was clean and the location was sufficient for a stay with regards to the conference I was at. Not a good location to vacation in Chicago. The staff was courteous, however, the internet was down for 2 days and the staff had no time frame or understanding of what the problem was.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: schoolmarm2
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at this hotel. Staff was very nice- the night shift was excellent! Loved the Starbucks coffee in the restaurant. Buffet was good. Room was very clean - loved the bed linens. Hotel was quiet. Very good stay - wished I had checked more on shuttle service since I was left at hotel while husband was off on business. We made do, but it might have been easier if I had checked on it. Staff recommendations for dining were excellent. Enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kissinkousin
Reviews.Content: Overnight in this hotel was provided by Amtrak due to missed train connection. Lovely hotel, comfortable large rooms, very nice restaurant and sports bar. Staff very nice and pleasant even when accomodating a large group of Amtrak travelers early in the morning. Across from Rush University Medical Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for the United Center with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Maggie12088
Reviews.Content: We especially appreciated the shuttle. The room was very comfortable and temperature controlled well. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: My two young sons and I were displaced by a late Amtrak train upon our arrival into Chicago and missed our connecting train. Amtrak put us up in this wonderful hotel. The front desk was simply awesome at check in. I asked if pizza deliverymen were allowed to bring the pizza upstairs or if we had to come down to pick up the pizza. The front desk clerk said that we had to come down but after looking at my tired children she said that with my permission she would allow the pizza man to come upstairs. A very nice touch. The lobby was simply beautiful. The evevators clean and well decorated. The room was spotless and the bed so comfy. Check out was a breeze and we were thanked for staying with Marriott. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Great service and employees and a wonderful room and most of all a very good nights sleep. Thanks Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “YES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Uhall
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Very Clean!! What more can I say? I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for patients and tourists”
Reviews.Author: travelindreams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our two children, 5 and 2, stayed here for a short weekend get away. It's very easy to get here by any mode of transportation. $10ish for a taxi from downtown, three blocks from pink line and four block to the bus that will take you to the museums. The neighborhood is quiet with great food just a couple blocks away. The front desk staff was great with directions and the shuttle driver will take you anywhere within about a mile of the hotel. They are all very accommodating and helpful! While there is no pool or great views this hotel is incredibly comfortable, clean and easy to get to. Our family will probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IF YOU NEED TO STAY CLOSE TO HOSPITAL”
Reviews.Author: vpdrzn
Reviews.Content: i stayed there 5 nights and even thought the location is perfect if you need to stay close the UIC hospital the hotel is quite miserable. the goods points are: a shuttle that brings you and come to pick you at the hospital and a big room. the bad points are: my room was dirty, i found pills from a previous client on the carpet, i left a sock in the middle of the room in the morning and by the evening it was still there, the restaurant service is terrible you need at least 40 minutes to receive your order and the evening staff is quiet unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “A week stuck in a hotel wasn't so bad.”
Reviews.Author: imouttahere2
Reviews.Content: First off this is a hotel for families to stay while a loved one is at the Medical Center. If you want to see Chicago, go elsewhere. It's a basic hotel, no fancy bells or whistles. But if you need a place near the medical center it can't be beat. I spent a week in the same hotel room with my son, post surgery. The front desk helped me find good lunches, exercise, do laundry, grocery shop, get downtown on the trains, etc. The weather was never above freezing, so I needed help to get everywhere. I was surprised when the week was over and we hadn't killed each other! I think this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginnynj4133
Reviews.Content: In the medical district for business and stayed 2 nights. I would like to comment on how friendly and helpful the staff were and the well appointed room that met my expectations. Although not a large hotel, the services, food and attention to detail were very good. From the front desk personnel, the van drivers to the wait staff: all were friendly, professional and genuinely caring. My experience here was positive and I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LynnetteB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my husband was having surgery. It is rather expensive and parking is charged also but it was so convenient to have a shuttle service to the hospital. Room was comfortable and clean. My only complaint is why put a towel bar directly in front of the sink? When you bend to wash your hands, your body is hitting the towel bar and the towels slip off. Beds were comfortable and staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service From the Staff-Nice room too!”
Reviews.Author: BeLLaJade
Reviews.Content: We were in from Orlando just to see a concert at the University(postponed after we flew in..more on thar later) and this was listed as the closest. Our plane arrived early and Rosemarie at the front desk was extremely gracious and allowed us to check in early. She along with the valet and the front desk staff recommended restaurants etc.. The room was surprisingly spacious, clean and had B&B products. They offered a free shuttle service and the driver was fantastic.. We were so bumbed about the concert and had to have a few at the bar.. The bartender was superb.. I've stayed in 5 star hotels in various parts of the globe and the staff were top notch and provided REAL courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient - If You Understand the Location”
Reviews.Author: LBW1795
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights while my husband underwent surgery at Rush University Medical Center located directly across the street. The room was good-sized and the bed was surprisingly comfortable. Another plus was that the bathroom was quite large, with lots of towels and almost immediate and plentiful hot water; the only missing items were a hair dryer and magnifying mirror. Finally, the staff was kind and gracious, with the food and drinks at Rooks Bistro very good and priced at regular urban standards. As other reviewers have noted, the surrounding neighborhood is perhaps not the best and indeed public transportation is not a good thought to pursue after dark. However, what I had not read earlier and was delighted to learn was that the hotel provides complimentary shuttle service not only to the hospital but to any location within a mile radius - that puts guests within easy and safe access to Chicago's Greek Town and Little Italy neighborhoods . . . and an untold number of absolutely FABULOUS restaurants and nightspots. If you're looking to come visit Chicago to see Michicgan Avenue, State Street, all the museums, etc., then you'll be much better off to find another place to stay, But if you or a loved one needs a quiet and comfortable place to stay while visiting Rush Medical Center, then this is the place to park.

Reviews.Title: “close to uic campus”
Reviews.Author: MelesaL
Reviews.Content: excellent accomidations. Rooms were luxerious and I felf pampered

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott comfort - nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either...”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with the UIC rate ($169/night). The good: + Comfortable, clean, spacious room + Conveniently located to UIC and 5 minutes from Taylor street (lots of restaurant options) + Friendly staff + Reasonable fitness room - ~6 pieces of cardio equipment and free weights with one bench + Reasonably priced restaurant with good selection of options (for a hotel) The bad: + Internet was wireless only and was not free - Marriott needs to differentiate itself by making this free across all of its brands. Internet access is now no longer the "novelty" it was two decades ago! + No ability to turn up the heat - choice was either Air Conditioning (very cold) or no fan. I went with the latter...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: neonjeckel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Chicago for a long weekend. We received this room from priceline.com for a wonderful discount. The hotal was very centrally located to everything we desired to do. We had no problems at all and the hotel was clean and as nice as other Marriots I have visited. Prices were slightly high, but that comes with staying at a Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: wolfp10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2009 while in Chicago to attend a sporting event at Soldier Field. The hotel is located just outside the loop and to the south of a major highway. The hotel appears to have been recently renovated. The amenities are modern and new. The bathrooms are rather large and quite functional. The hotel is located in the heart of the medical district, and as a result there are not many restaurants or shops in the immediate area. The closest CTA station is the Polk station on the pink line, which is directly connected to the loop. The hotel does offer a shuttle that leaves every half hour to bring you to local restaurants as well as to the Racine stop on the blue line, which will bring you to O'Hare Airport. My only complaint was the air conditioning wasn't working properly in my end of the hotel, and the hotel maintenance was slow to fix it after numerous rooms complained about it. Otherwise, the hotel staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and the hotel is in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Of course I say that given we booked the room through priceline at $60USD per night plus taxes. I would not pay the $350USD advertised on the website for the same time period. The actual hotel is quite modern or has been very recently updated. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, but the actual size of the rooms are quite small in comparison to other hotels. If you're only sleeping the in hotel like we did then it's not really a big deal. The front desk staff are extremely helpful. I called ahead to request things such as king beds, late check out, adjoining rooms and such but for some reason the request was lost. None the less the front desk staff worked quickly to still provide us with every requested item including an early check in as we arrive 2 hours earlier then expected. This hotel is only a couple blocks from Polk subway station to get downtown and from Taylor street where you can easily grab something to eat/drink. The area around the hotel is very clean and safe as well. The only complaint I would have is the ambulence sirens that go off in the night. I heard them once a night but other sound sleepers didn't hear them at all. It really was only a couple seconds before they were gone and I was asleep again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Nice as the Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tonypadre
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business at the end of September, into October, 2008. I thought the room was below average compared to the typical Marriott. The wallpaper was starting to peel in certain locations, the rug was a little worn, and the mattress was really hard. Also, I'm not sure if I was being more microscopic than usual, but I seemed to find lots of little hairs all over, including on the bedspread, pillows, and sheets. Perhaps the worst part of my experience was the noise. My room was facing the main road and Rush University is building a new hospital across the street from the hotel. On my first night, they were doing construction through the night and I had a tough time falling asleep. They did not work any of the other nights, but they did get started pretty early in the morning. Furthermore, there are a lot of other hospitals in the area (it's called Medical District for a good reason!) and I heard lots of ambulances throughout the night. Of course, I traveled with another person from my office and he did not complain of any noise, as his room was on a different side of the hotel and he could not hear the construction or ambulances. This hotel had a few positives, though. First and foremost, although you are not staying in the main Chicago downtown, there is a city bus line that is right outside the hotel and will take you downtown in less than 15 minutes for just two dollars each way. Also, you are in easy walking distance (about 3-4 blocks) of Little Italy where there are plenty of interesting local restaurants to dine at, and you can also walk to the Jewel-Osco supermarket. The hotel staff was very helpful, too. A worker at the front desk very happily printed out my airplane boarding pass for me (the free computer in the lobby - only for printing out boarding passes and not for free internet surfing - was not working) and she also reserved a shuttle for my trip back to O'Hare. If you plan on visiting Chicago for pure leisure, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. You'd be much better off staying in "The Loop" (the main downtown area), but if you have business to attend to on the South Side, I'd check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Functional place to stay in Chicgo”
Reviews.Author: MichFoodnWineLover
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here for our son's wedding, occupying 2 rooms with other family members and friends also staying. For $140/night in the Chicago area, it wasn't a bad value. The hotel is not downtown, but downtown is easily accessible by car (not recommended) or train. We found the employees to all be very friendly, pleasant and helpful. The breakfast, while pricey as one would expect in a chain hotel in a major city, wasn't exorbitant and was a pleasant buffet. On site parking is expensive at $28/day, but there really is not much other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago baseball weekend”
Reviews.Author: Allison0607
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old son and I stayed for a baseball weekend. The hotel is conveniently located between Wrigley and US Cellular. I was looking for a reasonable and safe place to stay and I was very pleased. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. An east / west and north / southbound bus is available right outside the door. The "L" is a friendly shuttle away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a simply lovely experience in Chicago right outside the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurtant/Bar/Breakfast - noisy room!”
Reviews.Author: myshgsh1
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was excellent, as was the menu for lunch and evening dinner and I had a delicious steak there. Friendly bar staff. Used their free shuttle servicve to take me back and forwards to the UIC for a conmference - they never ran it when you wanted to so you often had to take a taxi, but at <$10 a go, hardly painful. They dropped me off at the train station to take the subway to O'Hare airport - this is the ONLY way to do it - costs $2 and is direct and goes straight past teh traffic that you can see sitting stationary on the motorway and beats the $50 taxi fare it took to get to the hotel (off peak, arriving at 23:00hrs). The room was problematic - VERY noisy. Being in medical district, there were loud sierens and the air con unit made a racket - even when it was switched off, it whirred away so I'm glad I took ear plugs. The saving grace were the staff in the bar/restaurant. Not very convenient for going out and about in the evening - although within walking distance of Little Italy which did look ok, but I woulnd't have wanted to stray too far off the main road as the area looked a little rough.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you want to be near RUSH Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceBloom
Reviews.Content: This is like a low budget Marriot. Clean but the hotel had few amenities. Unless you want to be across the street from University of Illinois or RUSH medical center, do not use this hotel. The online information gave me the impression that getting into downtown and the loop was just a few easy trainstops down the road. Kind of true....it's two blocks to the train station and then several stops to downtown; it takes long enough that you don't want to go back and forth for the day, so you have to schlep all your stuff with you. My son lives in Chicago, and he did not advise that I (or any woman on her own) take the train at night, so that meant high taxi bills to get back. Others may disagree with the safety issue; hard to know when you don't live there. Anyway...the main problem is that this hotel is far from anything interesting. Also, the concierge was sweet but she really knew very little. She told me the wrong bus line, etc. Here is what I learned this trip: If you are going to bid on Priceline, do not include areas that you are not 100% sure of and don't go below four stars. I've gotten incredible deals that way, but this time, I lost out. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: samuel33
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay here and encountered no problems. They have a convenient no charge shuttle to several points which we took and then walked to our destination from there. We had breakfast at their restaurant and were not pleased with the choices or prices. They have a large variety of restaurant menus to choose from that would deliver, at their reception desk. We chose a Tai restaurant one night that was excellent. It was overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DasEFX
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago to go to a club with a bunch of friends for the weekend. We decided to stay here because it was very well priced. There are lots of good things to say about this hotel. The rooms were big and clean. The bedroom had two big comfy beds. The bathroom had: shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lots of towels. The only negative is it is VERY hard to catch a cab outside of the hotel. During the day, it is a short walk to the subway, but it didn't feel safe enough to catch a train at night. The desk staff was very good about getting cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Got checked into someone else's room!”
Reviews.Author: emmers_91
Reviews.Content: Well when we checked into the hotel, my first impression was, wow ok better then I expected. The lobby was nice with some comfy chairs to seat in. Then we got all checked in and headed upstairs to our room. Guess what! The room was already occupied!! They had checked us into a room that had someone in it. Thank God that person wasn't in the room at the time, because that would have been relativly uncomfertable... Anyway we headed back down to the lobby to get a different room. What we had expected was an upgrade or a night free or something of the sort, but no, all we got was an apology. In our second room things weren't that great. There was a ciggarette hole in the curtains, the carpet was falling apart in one area, the bathroom door handle was broken, it was almost impossible to get cold water from the faucet, and the faucet squeaked VERY loudly. Our first night we noticed you can hear EVERYTHING that happens in the halls, people were out there all night long banging on doors and talking loudly. And, while I'm sure it was nice, the breakfast buffet in the adjoining restuarant was $25, which is absoulutly rediculous! There are some redeeming qualities of the hotel however, it was decorated very nicely and only 3 blocks from an el station, which was wonderful, we didn't have to use our car all weekend. And it's only a block or two away from a cafe called Pompeii which was delicious! And on the same street (Taylor, I think) there were many restaurants including the orginal Rosebud's and Starbucks. But being the Medical District you are right across the street from The Rush Medical Center, which could be good for some, but not us. The ambulance entrance was right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for business. For business purposes, especially if you are working in the area this hotel is fine, your average marriott, nothing that special. The rooms are comfortable but dated. The beds are very comfortable and the a.c worked well, I had no problem sleeping. The bathrooms are a bit dated and small but you can work with it. The internet is WiFi and a bit slow but it does ok. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and makes a big difference here when rating this hotel. Otherwise the rooms are basic, a bit dated, a little worn but comfortable. Its fine if you have something going on in the area, but if your in Chicago for anything other then business in the area you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall for business travelers, tourists should look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: brickbark
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here a few weeks ago and this hotel was quite nice inside. No pool, but nice workout center. The service at the desk was good, but the valet was HORRIBLE. Had to sit in my car for several minutes and then finally got out and walked up to him (he was on his phone) and he said "just leave it, I got it". Same thing happened when I was leaving (on his phone) and he didn't bother to help me with all the luggage I had or anything. They don't offer self-parking either, so be prepared for the hefty 21 dollar valet charge. This hotel is convienent to the UIC campus, but there are better hotels that are much closer to things so I would discourage you from coming to this hotel unless for business. It is convienent to the expressway/loop.

Reviews.Title: “Hot apple cider and cookies,”
Reviews.Author: bigpat8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 weekend nights, got a great deal on Priceline. Staff were great on arrival, very friendly, very quick check-in. Room was very large, 2 Queen size beds (unusual for big city hotel) and immaculately clean. Beds were so comfortable and best pillows ever (according to my wife) Although not quite city centre, still very central (opposite Rush medical centre). Taxis were cheap, $8 to Sears Tower, $9 to downtown, $11 to Rush and Division for nightlife, $13 to Navy Pier. Little Italy is only about a 10 minute walk. One very nice gesture was the complimentary hot apple cider and homemade cookies awaiting guests in the foyer. It was very cold outside so it was greatly appreciated. Also breakfast buffet ($11, i think), was excellent. Great porridge and proper sausages. Overall this is a superb 3 star hotel (could easily be 4 star). Had a great stay and would heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A clean room only minutes away from dowtown”
Reviews.Author: Travelmember1
Reviews.Content: Went with five couples overnight. Four of us stayed here. Rooms were nice and clean. The hotel is not a 5-star, nor does it claim to be. Would definitely go back again. Only 2 blocks from the CTA's L train that will take you downtown in 10 minutes for very reasonable - $2.00/person one way, much cheaper than parking downtown or taking a taxi. If you are looking for the downtown Chicago hotel experience with a view, this isn't it. If you are looking for a reasonable, clean room for quite a bit less & only minutes away, this is the one. It definitely met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a very high 3 if not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Rush hospital cancer treatment center. Many times I would rather not fight with the rush hour traffic so I began staying at this hotel right acrass the street. The shuttle will take you to the hospital, although it runs on a 1/2 hr schedule. Yuo can park in the parking ramp to avoid the $26 a night valet parking fee (Only parking offered). The hospital information desk sells parking passes for $20.00 for 5 stays, each stay 24 hrs or less per pass. The hotel is very elegant and beautifully decorated. The rooms arent overly large but spacous enough. The beds are top quality pillow top mattresses with super fluffy comforters. Rooks,the gourmet resturaunt on the first level, has a wide variety on the menu and also supplies a more limited menu for room service of excellent quality and less expensive than you would expect. Some rooms are business oriented with a nice work area with extra outlets. If you get a business room look at your bill because the computer system automatically adds $9.95 to your bill for wireles internet access. They have a few discounts for RUSH patients and prospective staff members but even without a discount I think you would be hard pressed to find a better/cheaper cost same quality hotel anywhere this close to the loop. The staff is completely professional, Kind and courteous From the valet to the Room service waitor and everyone in between. Aside from the few quirks (parking and internet things) This hotel is definitely worth planning a stay. I Am staying therelater today. K Gilgan

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: An outstanding room and a great night of sleep. The bed and comforter were top notch, the room was modern with all of the conveniences. Clean facilities. Service at the restaurant was a little slow, but the food was good. Not inexpensive (this is Chicago). Iâ€™d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! It was very clean and the room was extremely comfortable. The pillows were soft and fluffy and the sheets and blankets were wonderful. They were also able to give us a ride downtown in the hotel's van, which was very nice. I would definetly stay here again even though it is not in the heart of downtown. Parking is expensive, but you will find that at most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you are interviewing for a UIC position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while interviewing for a residency spot at UIC. Clean. Friendly. Very close. Resident recruitment rate of $119/night. I was under the impression you'd get free internet via ethernet cables, but you have to pay $10 per day to rent a wireless password. Nice bar with a friendly bartender, also from Hawaii. Breakfast is tasty in the Rooks Corner restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Chicago Marriott at Medical District/UIC
HotelInfo.Address: 625 South Ashland Avenue at Harrison Street, Chicago, IL 60607
